answers.answer: Hi!It sounds to me like you have a very common sydrome known as syndrome X or metabolic syndrome or PCOS.  This is a syndrome in which insulin resistance (which can and often does proceed to diabetes) is associated with failure to ovulate regularly which in turn make the periods irregular.This usually SHOULD be treated some how.  The uterus usually needs to clean itself at least once every three months to stay healthy--otherwise the lining can build up and get so thick that it start bleeding continously for weeks on end--sometimes heavy sometimes light, sometimes clotty, sometimes spotty--sound familiar?The reason I say it should be treated is that I have actually seen a case of a 27-year-old who developed cancer of the uterine lining due to years of build up of tissue in the lining.Treatment could be birth control pills (cheap at Planned Parenthood) or the depot shot (also cheap at Planned Parenthood) or some people choose to take provera every three months to cause the lining to clean off.  Other people take medicine to help them get pregnant.  We also usually recommend--You guessed it!--weight loss.You should also be tested for diabetis and watched for that.A trip to your doctor or neighborhood nurse practitioner now might save you a lot of money and head ache down the road!Good luck!Dr B .

title: Abnormal Bleeding for 3 months
